title: Blood type diet? No evidence for it, and no explanation why it would work
subtitle: Does your blood group affect the type of food you should eat?
author: africacheck.org

‘Serious questions about why it should work’

But what’s the theory behind the diet?

, type O “was said to be the original ‘ancestral’ blood type of the earliest humans who were hunter-gatherers, with diets that were high in animal protein”. Blood type A is said to have evolved when humans began to farm, about 10,000 years ago. The group B blood types were “said to arise among nomadic tribes who consumed a lot of dairy products”. And so on.
